title: (x) Snowflakes- various {gang}
content: Is there a font consisting either partially or entirely of snowflakes?
author: jonny

comments.content: Jonny check out DaFonts for symbol fonts
Why, [yes, there are](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516141355/http:/www.dafont.com/en/search.php?nq=1&q=snowflake). Daniel and I think along the same lines here.

There's also one in the Image Club library.   
   
 [Mini Pics Snowflakes](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516141355/http:/www.identifont.com/show?8GO) (designed by yours truly)
Isn't there a snowflake font on the [Building Letters CD](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516141355/http:/www.buildingletters.org/)?

I haven't tried it myself, but you can [make your own snowflake](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516141355/http:/snowflakes.lookandfeel.com/). (via [Woodge](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516141355/http:/www.woodge.com/))
Karen, that's a very slick snowflake toy. I had never seen that before. Thanks for the pointer.

I'm glad you like it. It only means that I'm surfing too much for my own good. Btw, do you know where we can buy a copy of [Bookman Swash](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516141355/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/19758.html) online?
[Precision Type](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516141355/http:/www.precisiontype.com/main.asp) has the Bookman Swash fonts. Just type it in the search window.

Just came across this [free snowflake font](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516141355/http:/www.p22.com/free/snow.html)   
from P22 (until year's end only).

I know the original poster is long gone, but [here's something](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516141355/http:/www.aenigmafonts.com/fonts/fonts.html) (click on   
New in the Fonts menu)almost brand new from Aenigma for anyone   
out there wanting type snowflakes. I think I like this one best of all!
